summary: Miss webkit css related extern file when mapping to javascript format.

comments.content:
Although closure provides webkit css extern file here:
http://code.google.com/p/closure-compiler/source/browse/trunk/externs/webkit_css.js

when we use the properties in javascript, they will be renamed by closure.

For example.

CSSProperties.prototype.WebkitTransitionProperty is defined in webkit_css.js

while we use 

element.style.webkitTransitionProperty = '-webkit-transform';

WebkitTransitionProperty is not the same as webkitTransitionProperty 

The reason is javascript is case sensitive. 

Thanks.

actually, WebkitTransitionProperty is the same as webkitTransitionProperty.

WebkitTransitionProperty is technically the correct property, because in CSS it's -webkit-transition-proprety (note the initial "-")

http://www.webkit.org/blog/138/css-animation/

this was so confusing to people that they added a second binding to the same property with the name webkitTransitionProperty.

should we just support both?
i sent an email to the webkit folks to see if i can get more details on why it's done this way.
This issue was closed by revision r803.
